page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: Separating Hardgate and Faifley from the rest of Clydebank runs the busy A82 which is a dual carriageway known locally as "the boulevard".It carries all traffic north up the west coast of Scotland or east to the centre of Glasgow.It also connects with the Erskine Bridge to take vehicles down to the Firth of Clyde or to Glasgow Airport. Half the population have cars and use these routes frequently for business and pleasure. There are no train services in this area but the residents are well- served by buses connecting Faifley etc. with the centre of Clydebank. Other bus services provide easy access to Glasgow which is only 20 minutes away.
